title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open file in another editor when it is already open in one editor (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] When a file is already open in one editor, attempting to open it in another editor does not produce any result. Instead, a warning message or error message should be displayed, informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue. This behavior is believed to be a safety feature in WSAD that does not allow external editing when a file is already open in WSAD.
OB:
1. Open a file in WSAD.
2. Switch to the Java Perspective.
3. Double click on a Java file to open it in the workbench.
4. Right click on the same Java file.
5. Select 'Open With' > 'System Editor'.
6. Observe that nothing happens.

Expected Result: The workbench should display a warning message or error message, informing the user that they may overwrite changes and asking if they want to continue editing the file in the new editor.
